page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF THE LANDSCAPE
page.content: The block we are covering is situated just to the east of the City of York. The western edge of the block borders the York by-pass and the zone extends across very flat land in the Vale. Stockton on Forest sounds as if it is a village surrounded by trees.It certainly was in Norman times but today most of the trees have gone and apart from the houses in the village the area is mostly a rich vale of cereals and grassland . The farmers grow mainly barley which is used for cattle feed but some is sent to Scotland for whisky making. Tons of sugar beet are grown and sent to the York Sugar Beet factory every Autumn. Winter wheat is another very important crop and so is Oil Seed Rape.
